StepMatchArgument.description:
Represents a single argument extracted from a step match and passed to a step definition.
This is used for the following purposes:
- Construct an argument to pass to a step definition (possibly through a parameter type transform)
- Highlight the matched parameter in rich formatters such as the HTML formatter

This message closely matches the `Argument` class in the `cucumber-expressions` library.

group.description:
Represents the outermost capture group of an argument. This message closely matches the
`Group` class in the `cucumber-expressions` library.

TestStep.description:
A `TestStep` is derived from either a `PickleStep`
combined with a `StepDefinition`, or from a `Hook`.

hookId.description: Pointer to the `Hook` (if derived from a Hook)

pickleStepId.description: Pointer to the `PickleStep` (if derived from a `PickleStep`)

stepDefinitionIds.description:
Pointer to all the matching `StepDefinition`s (if derived from a `PickleStep`)
Each element represents a matching step definition. A size of 0 means `UNDEFINED`,
and a size of 2+ means `AMBIGUOUS`

stepMatchArgumentsLists.description: A list of list of StepMatchArgument (if derived from a `PickleStep`).

pickleId.description: The ID of the `Pickle` this `TestCase` is derived from.

testRunStartedId.description: Identifier for the test run that this test case belongs to
